back: A numerical value calculated from data that measures some characteristic of the data.
A value in the data set that appears most often. As there may be more than one most common value, the mode of a data set is not unique.

A value $m$ such that the number of data points that are less than $m$ is equal to the number of data points that are greater than $m$. For some data sets, there may be multiple values that satisfy this criterion, so the median is not always unique.
